intro: Elettariopsis rugosa, commonly known as the rough elettariopsis, is a flowering plant species belonging to the family Acanthaceae. It is characterized by its rugged, hairy leaves and clusters of small, tubular flowers that typically bloom in shades of purple or pink. Native to tropical and subtropical regions, this plant thrives in humid, well-drained soils and partial to full sunlight. Its unique foliage and ornamental flowers make it a sought-after plant in horticulture. Elettariopsis rugosa is also valued for its potential medicinal properties, though further research is needed to confirm its therapeutic uses.
